Description: Rim and body fragment of North Ionian meander rim pottery plate; white slip on top. Maeander band on rim; ornamental zone on inside bordered by zones of black glaze with added white-red-white stripes; frieze of concentric circles linked by triple horizontals and added leaves. Broad verticals on edge of rim; on underside, one set of three bands and one of two (preserved) in red-fired glaze. Numerous calcareous inclusions in light brown clay; little mica.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.768)
